text: Arilla was a village of ancient Lydia, inhabited during Roman times. The village was allowed to hold an annual seven-day fair in September from the year 134-135 by Titus Aurelius Fulvus Boionius, then governor of Asia. Its site is located near Hacıhasankıranı in Asiatic Turkey. ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Lydia Category:Former populated places in Turkey Category:Roman towns and cities in Turkey Category:History of Manisa Province
